name: site_identifiers
comment: Links local site identifiers to their corresponding site.

name: updatelog
comment: A table to log updates, one text key row per update.

name: actor
comment: The "actor" table associates user names or IP addresses with integers for the benefit of other tables that need to refer to either logged-in or logged-out users. If something can only ever be done by logged-in users, it can refer to the user table directly.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.comment: Unique ID to identify each actor

columns.name: actor_user
columns.comment: Key to user.user_id, or NULL for anonymous edits

name: user_former_groups
comment: Stores the groups the user has once belonged to. The user may still belong to these groups (check user_groups). Autopromotion of users to groups from which they were removed can be restricted by using wgAutopromoteOnce instead of wgAutopromote.

name: bot_passwords
comment: This table contains a user's bot passwords: passwords that allow access to the account via the API with limited rights.

columns.name: bp_grants
columns.comment: Grants allowed to the account when authenticated with this bot-password

name: comment
comment: Edits, blocks, and other actions typically have a textual comment describing the action. They are stored here to reduce the size of the main tables, and to allow for deduplication. Deduplication is currently best-effort to avoid locking on inserts that would be required for strict deduplication. There MAY be multiple rows with the same comment_text and comment_data.

columns.name: comment_id
columns.comment: Unique ID to identify each comment

columns.name: comment_hash
columns.comment: Hash of comment_text and comment_data, for deduplication

columns.name: comment_text
columns.comment: Text comment summarizing the change. This text is shown in the history and other changes lists, rendered in a subset of wiki markup by Linker::formatComment(). Size limits are enforced at the application level, and should take care to crop UTF-8 strings appropriately.

columns.name: comment_data
columns.comment: JSON data, intended for localizing auto-generated comments. This holds structured data that is intended to be used to provide localized versions of automatically-generated comments. When not empty, comment_text should be the generated comment localized using the wiki's content language.

name: slots
comment: Slots represent an n:m relation between revisions and content objects. A content object can have a specific "role" in one or more revisions. Each revision can have multiple content objects, each having a different role.

columns.name: slot_origin
columns.comment: The revision ID of the revision that originated the slot's content. To find revisions that changed slots, look for slot_origin = slot_revision_id. TODO: Is that actually true? Rollback seems to violate it by setting slot_origin to an older rev_id. Undeletions could result in the same situation.

indexes.name: slot_revision_origin_role
indexes.comment: Index for finding revisions that modified a specific slot

name: site_stats
comment: Contains a single row with some aggregate info on the state of the site.

columns.name: ss_row_id
columns.comment: The single row should contain 1 here.

columns.name: ss_total_pages
columns.comment: Total pages, theoretically equal to SELECT COUNT(*) FROM page.

columns.name: ss_users
columns.comment: Number of users, theoretically equal to SELECT COUNT(*) FROM user.

columns.name: ss_active_users
columns.comment: Number of users that still edit.

columns.name: ss_images
columns.comment: Number of images, equivalent to SELECT COUNT(*) FROM image.

name: user_properties
comment: User preferences and perhaps other fun stuff. :) Replaces the old user.user_options blob, with a couple nice properties: 1) We only store non-default settings, so changes to the defaults are now reflected for everybody, not just new accounts. 2) We can more easily do bulk lookups, statistics, or modifications of saved options since it's a sane table structure.

columns.name: up_property
columns.comment: Name of the option being saved. This is indexed for bulk lookup.

columns.name: ls_field
columns.comment: The type of ID (rev ID, log ID, rev timestamp, username)

name: change_tag
comment: A table to track tags for revisions, logs and recent changes

columns.name: ct_params
columns.comment: Parameters for the tag; used by some extensions

indexes.name: change_tag_tag_id_id
indexes.comment: Covering index, so we can pull all the info only out of the index.

name: content
comment: The content table represents content objects. It's primary purpose is to provide the necessary meta-data for loading and interpreting a serialized data blob to create a content object.

columns.name: content_size
columns.comment: Nominal size of the content object (not necessarily of the serialized blob)

columns.name: content_sha1
columns.comment: Nominal hash of the content object (not necessarily of the serialized blob)

columns.name: content_model
columns.comment: reference to model_id. Note the content format isn't specified; it should be assumed to be in the default format for the model unless auto-detected otherwise.

columns.name: content_address
columns.comment: URL-like address of the content blob

name: l10n_cache
comment: Table for storing localisation data

name: module_deps
comment: Table caching which local files a module depends on that aren't registered directly, used for fast retrieval of file dependency. Currently only used for tracking images that CSS depends on

columns.name: md_skin
columns.comment: Module context vary (includes skin and language; called "md_skin" for legacy reasons)

name: redirect
comment:
For each redirect, this table contains exactly one row defining its target.
Redirect targets are key to page_namespace/page_title of the target page.
The target page may or may not exist, and due to renames
and deletions may refer to different page records as time
goes by.

columns.name: rd_from
columns.comment: Key to the page_id of the redirect page

name: pagelinks
comment: Track page-to-page hyperlinks within the wiki. The target page may or may not exist, and due to renames and deletions may refer to different page records as time goes by.

columns.name: pl_from
columns.comment: Key to the page_id of the page containing the link.

indexes.name: pl_backlinks_namespace
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Whatlinkshere with namespace filter

name: templatelinks
comment: Track template inclusions. The target page may or may not exist, and due to renames and deletions may refer to different page records as time goes by.

columns.name: tl_from
columns.comment: Key to the page_id of the page containing the link.

indexes.name: tl_backlinks_namespace
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Whatlinkshere with namespace filter

name: imagelinks
comment: Track links to images *used inline* We don't distinguish live from broken links here, so they do not need to be changed on upload/removal.

columns.name: il_from
columns.comment: Key to page_id of the page containing the image / media link.

columns.name: il_to
columns.comment: Filename of target image. This is also the page_title of the file's description page; all such pages are in namespace 6 (NS_FILE).

indexes.name: il_to
indexes.comment: Reverse index, for Special:Whatlinkshere and file description page local usage

indexes.name: il_backlinks_namespace
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Whatlinkshere with namespace filter

name: langlinks
comment: Track interlanguage links.

columns.name: ll_title
columns.comment: Title of the target, including namespace

name: iwlinks
comment: Track inline interwiki links

columns.name: iwl_prefix
columns.comment: Interwiki prefix code of the target

columns.name: iwl_title
columns.comment: Title of the target, including namespace

name: category
comment: Track all existing categories. Something is a category if 1) it has an entry somewhere in categorylinks, or 2) it has a description page. Categories might not have corresponding pages, so they need to be tracked separately. The numbers of member pages (including categories and media), subcategories, and Image: namespace members, respectively are included in this table too.  These are signed to make underflow more obvious.  We make the first number include the second two for better sorting: subtracting for display is easy, adding for ordering is not.

columns.name: cat_title
columns.comment: Name of the category, in the same form as page_title (with underscores). If there is a category page corresponding to this category, by definition, it has this name (in the Category namespace).

name: watchlist_expiry
comment: Allows setting an expiry for watchlist items.

name: change_tag_def
comment: Table defining tag names for IDs. Also stores hit counts to avoid expensive queries on change_tag

columns.name: ctd_id
columns.comment: Numerical ID of the tag (ct_tag_id refers to this)

columns.name: ctd_name
columns.comment: Symbolic name of the tag (what would previously be put in ct_tag)

columns.name: ctd_user_defined
columns.comment: Whether this tag was defined manually by a privileged user using Special:Tags

columns.name: ctd_count
columns.comment: Number of times this tag was used

name: ipblocks_restrictions
comment: Partial Block Restrictions

columns.name: ir_value
columns.comment: The restriction id that corresponds to the type. Typically a Page ID or a Namespace ID.

indexes.name: ir_type_value
indexes.comment: Index to query restrictions by the page or namespace.
